author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Claims that govt. is not allowing even peaceful activities of Hurriyat leadership

Disallowing it first was an act of suppression, says Mirwaiz Umar Farooq.

Two days after the authorities denied permission to its release, All-Parties Hurriyat Conference chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq on Thursday released the documentary, Children in conflict-torn Kashmir , at his office here. The release of the documentary at the Sara City Mall, Srinagar, was disallowed by the authorities on March 2.

Terming it “undemocratic and dictatorial,” Mr. Farooq said: “By using suppressive measures, the government was stifling the right to freedom of expression of Kashmiris.”

Holding the film’s screening (which was allowed on Thursday) before a limited audience at the APHC headquarters, the Mirwaiz said: “The government was not even allowing peaceful activities of the Hurriyat leadership by continuing to abort their programmes. Disallowing the screening of the documentary was another such instance of strong-arm tactics of the government.”
title: Screening of documentary on Kashmir children allowed
